Field Detail

PREFERRED_FONT

public static java.awt.Font PREFERRED_FONT
The font that most of Cabra tries to use. 14pt.

SMALLER_PREFERRED_FONT

public static java.awt.Font SMALLER_PREFERRED_FONT
The same as PREFERRED_FONT, except it's 2pt smaller.

LARGER_PREFERRED_FONT

public static java.awt.Font LARGER_PREFERRED_FONT
The same as PREFERRED_FONT, except it's 2pt bigger.

GOOD_FONT_SIZES

public static final int[] GOOD_FONT_SIZES
The array of preferred font sizes; one of these should be used.

DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE
The best and default font size.

Method Detail

updatePreferredFont

public static void updatePreferredFont(java.lang.String fontName,
                                       int fontSize)
Updates the PREFERRED_FONT to the given parameters. You should only pass one. NOTE: you have to validate the frame after this

Parameters:
fontName - the new font name/family. pass null if you don't want to change it.
fontSize - the new size of the font. pass 0 if you don't want to change it.

hasFontName

public static boolean hasFontName(java.lang.String fontName)
Sees if the given font is available on this machine.

Parameters:
fontName - the name of the font
Returns:
true if the font is available, false if it isn't

getAvailablePreferredFontNames

public static java.lang.String[] getAvailablePreferredFontNames()
Returns an array containing all the available font names that are in the preferred list.

Returns:
an array of Strings with the names of the fonts.

getAllAvailableFontNames

public static java.lang.String[] getAllAvailableFontNames()
Returns an array containing all the available font names.

Returns:
an array of Strings with the names of the fonts.

getFirstAvailableFontName

private static java.lang.String getFirstAvailableFontName(java.lang.String... fontNames)
Attempts to get a suitable font name as specified by the caller.

Parameters:
fontNames - the list of requested font names. If the first one isn't there, try the next.
Returns:
the first font name that works

createFont

public static java.awt.Font createFont(int size,
                                       int style,
                                       java.lang.String... fontNames)

createFont

public static java.awt.Font createFont(int size,
                                       java.lang.String... fontNames)
Same as createFont, except it defaults to plain style

Parameters:
size - the size preferred
fontNames - the names of the fonts you want
Returns:
the created font

randomFontName

public static java.lang.String randomFontName()
Finds a random installed font and returns its name

Returns:
